isis.stitle: TSI 95-16-02 - Heater and Air Conditioning System Changes

subjectgroup.subject: Heater and Air Conditioning System Changes

geninfo.para: The heater-air conditioning (a/c) assembly under the instrument panel has been redesigned for 2000, 4000 and 8000 Models built after December 5, 1994. This letter contains information to service components in the heater-a/c assembly on these vehicles.

important.para: Refer to TSI-95-16-01 for information on how to capture and recycle refrigerant when repairing air conditioning systems. Do not release refrigerant into the atmosphere

svcprocinfo.para: Service information will be described by component. All components in the assembly may be serviced without removing the heater-a/c unit. The system no longer has a hot water valve. The amount of heat/cooling desired in the cab is controlled by the position of the Blend Air door. The receiver dryer, refrigerant compressor, condenser and hoses were not affected by this change to the heater-a/c system.

svcsubproc.title: General
svcsubproc.para: The following steps must be performed prior to removing any of the heater-a/c assembly components under the right side of the instrument panel.

step1.para: Remove four (4) screws from the lower right instrument panel cover, unplug the power window electrical control (if equipped) and remove the cover ( Figure 1).
Remove lower relay panel ( Figure 2).
Remove 2 screws and slide drain tray out ( Figure 1).
Remove heater-a/c unit assembly cover ( Figure 1).

svcsubproc.title: Service Steps
svcsubproc.para: The following steps must be performed following any service performed in the heater-a/c assembly under the right side of the instrument panel.

step1.para: Install the heater-a/c assembly cover ( Figure 1).
Install drain tray ( Figure 1).
Install lower relay panel ( Figure 2).
Connect the power window electrical connector to the power window switch (if required) on the lower right instrument panel cover ( Figure 1).
Install the lower right instrument panel cover ( Figure 1).

svcsubproc.title: Remove
svcsubproc.para: After the lower right instrument panel cover, lower relay panel, drain tray and heater-a/c assembly cover have been removed, the air filter can be pulled out of the unit for service. A new filter is recommended once a year.

svcsubproc.title: Install
svcsubproc.para: Push the new filter into the opening next to the evaporator until it is flush with the front of the opening and will not interfere with installation of the heater-a/c assembly cover ( Figure 1 and Figure 3).

warning.para: Allow the engine to cool down before removing the pressure cap from the deaeration tank. ALWAYS INSULATE the cap by wrapping it with a thick, heavy cloth. To prevent possible injury from scalding water or steam, DO NOT pull the pressure cap off immediately when it has been loosened to the first "notch." Pause momentarily to allow time for excess pressure to release through the overflow tube.

caution.para: Removal and installation of the heater core should be done with two (2) people, one inside and one outside of the cab to help guide the tube ends of the core through the dash panel seal. This will greatly reduce the possibility of the dash panel seal becoming damaged.

step1.para: Drain engine coolant. Refer to GROUP 12-COOLING in the CTS 5000 Master Service Manual.
Remove both heater hoses at engine side of dash panel.
From the engine side of the dash panel, run a screwdriver around both heater hose tubes protruding through the dash panel to separate sealant from the tubes.
Remove one nut and lock washer from the engine side of the dash panel that holds the heater core in place ( Figure 4).
From inside the cab, remove heater core lower plate ( Figure 5).

From inside the cab, pull the heater core out of the heater-a/c unit ( Figure 6). Care should be taken not to damage the dash panel seal when the heater hose tubes pass through the dash panel seal ( Figure 7).

From inside the cab, start the tube ends of the core through the dash panel seal. Because of the angle bend on the tubes, it will be very easy to damage the dash panel seal if the tubes are not guided through the seal from the engine side of the dash panel ( Figure 7). Guide the stud on the heater core into the hole in the dash panel ( Figure 4).
From inside the cab, install the heater core lower plate ( Figure 5).
Install a lock washer and nut on the stud ( Figure 4) and tighten to 6 to 8 ft-lbs. (8 to 11 N•m).
Install heater hoses and clamps.
Fill the cooling system with coolant. Refer to the OPERATOR'S MANUAL.
Slide switch from heater-a/c unit assembly ( Figure 8).
Disconnect electrical connectors.
Carefully pull the capillary tube from the evaporator core and remove the thermostat switch.
Carefully install the capillary tube in the evaporator. Be sure to install in different location in evaporator, to the same depth as before. DO NOT install in same opening as it was removed from.
When the capillary tube is fully installed, connect electrical connectors to switch, then slide switch into its holder on the heater-a/c unit.

warning.para: One of the most important precautions to be taken while servicing air conditioning systems is to wear constant and adequate eye protection. Safety goggles or other adequate eye protection must be worn. The temperature of liquid refrigerant is -100°F (-73°C). Serious injury or blindness will result from refrigerant contacting the eyes.

caution.para: Removal and installation of the evaporator should be done with two (2) people, one inside and one outside of the cab to help guide the connector end of the evaporator into the dash panel seal. This will greatly reduce the possibility of the evaporator connections and the dash panel seal becoming damaged.

step1.para: Remove refrigerant. Refer to GROUP 16 - AIR CONDITIONING BASIC THEORY, SYSTEM DIAGNOSIS AND SERVICE in the CTS 5000 Master Service Manual for information on recovering refrigerant.
Remove air cleaner to turbo connection clamp.

note.para: Some models do not have an air cleaner in this location, but have other components (fuel heater, etc.) that must be removed.

step1.para: Remove air cleaner air restriction gauge.
Remove four (4) air cleaner mounting bracket fasteners from the dash panel and remove air cleaner ( Figure 9).
Remove expansion valve. Refer to EXPANSION VALVE Remove.

From the engine side of the dash panel, remove the nuts and lock washers that hold the evaporator in place ( Figure 10). One nut and washer is inside the sled runner. It will be necessary to use a magnet to remove the washer to prevent it from falling down inside the sled runner.
From inside the cab, disconnect the electrical connector from the low pressure switch ( Figure 11).
Pull evaporator out of the a/c unit and remove from the vehicle ( Figure 11).
Install the evaporator into the heater-a/c unit until the connector end is in the dash panel seal ( Figure 12) and the two studs on the evaporator protrude through the dash panel ( Figure 10).
Install a lock washer and nut on both studs ( Figure 10) and tighten the nuts to 6 to 8 ft-lbs. (8 to 11 N•m).
Connect the electrical connector to the low pressure switch ( Figure 11).
Install expansion valve on the evaporator. Refer to EXPANSION VALVE Install.
Re-install the air cleaner to the dash panel with the four (4) fasteners removed in step 4 under EVAPORATOR Remove.
Install air cleaner restriction gauge.
Install air cleaner to turbo hose and clamp.
Remove refrigerant. Refer to GROUP 16 - AIR CONDITIONING BASIC THEORY, SYSTEM DIAGNOSIS AND SERVICE in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual for information on recovering refrigerant from the system.
Remove the 10 mm nut from the center of the expansion valve ( Figure 13).
Pull the plate both a/c lines are attached to away from the expansion valve ( Figure 13). Remove and discard O-rings.
Remove two (2) Allen head screws that fasten the expansion valve to the evaporator ( Figure 14).
Disconnect the electrical connector from the high pressure cut-off switch ( Figure 14) and remove the expansion valve.
If the expansion valve or high pressure cut-off switch is to be replaced, remove the high pressure cut-off switch from the valve.
Before installing the expansion valve, lubricate NEW O-rings with mineral oil.
Install the O-rings on the evaporator fittings that protrude through the dash panel seal ( Figure 12).

Install the expansion valve with the stud side facing out ( Figure 14) and secure in place with two (2) Allen head screws removed in step 4 of EXPANSION VALVE Remove. Tighten to 79-89 in-lbs. (8.9-10 N•m).

Install NEW O-rings on the ends of both lines that will be installed on the expansion valve. Slide the plate that holds both lines into place on the stud. Install the 10 mm lock nut and tighten it to 80 to 90 in-lbs. (9 to 10 N•m).

caution.para: Do not over-tighten the 10 mm lock nut. Too much torque will strip the threads on the stud, which will require replacing the expansion valve.

step1.para: Install high pressure cut-off switch ( Figure 14).
Plug the electrical connector into the high pressure cut-off switch.

Recharge a/c system with R-134a refrigerant. Refer to GROUP 16-AIR CONDITIONING BASIC THEORY, SYSTEM DIAGNOSIS AND SERVICE in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual for information on recharging the system with R-134a refrigerant.

svcsubproc.title: Remove
svcsubproc.para: The Blend Air door can be removed by first removing the heater core. Refer to HEATER CORE Remove and Install in this section. It's not necessary to remove the evaporator.

step1.para: Unhook temperature control cable from the plastic lever on the Blend Air door ( Figure 15).
Pull the plastic lever off the Blend Air door ( Figure 15).
Remove the Blend Air door.
Install Blend Air door inside the heater-a/c unit
Push plastic lever onto the door shaft.
Hook the temperature control cable onto the plastic lever ( Figure 15).
Disconnect electrical connector from resistor.
Remove screws that secure resistor base to the heater-a/c unit ( Figure 16). Notice where screws and shield are positioned and remove resistor.
To install, reverse Remove procedure.
Disconnect electrical connector from blower motor ( Figure 17).
Remove screw from ground strap ( Figure 17).
Unhook vent hose ( Figure 17).
Remove five (5) mounting screws on the motor flange.
Pull motor with blower wheel out of the heater-a/c assembly.
Position blower motor assembly in opening in the heater-a/c housing.
Install mounting screws.
Install vent hose ( Figure 17).
Install ground strap screw ( Figure 17).
Connect electrical connector to plug on blower motor ( Figure 17).
Remove upper driver side defrost trim panel (one screw on top and one on the side) ( Figure 18).
Remove the seven (7) screws that secure the left lower instrument panel cover in place and remove the panel ( Figure 18).
Remove the two (2) screws that hold the control assembly in place and pull assembly toward you to expose the back side of the assembly ( Figure 19).

To remove a cable actuator from the control panel cover, pull the knob(s) off the cable actuator shaft(s) that protrude through the control assembly cover ( Figure 19). Remove the hex nut that secures the cable actuator to the cover ( Figure 19) and remove the actuator from the cover. Unsnap the control cable from the actuator and remove the actuator.

To remove each control cable, it will be necessary to disconnect the defrost control cable from the defrost door in the heater-a/c duct, up under the instrument panel and the temperature control cable, from the Blend Air door lever on the heater-a/c unit. Refer to BLEND AIR DOOR Remove in this section.

para.emph: If the complete control panel assembly was removed, perform the following:

step1.para: Install the control unit by feeding the defrost and temperature control cables behind the instrument panel to the door they control.
Secure the control panel to the instrument panel with two (2) screws.
Install the left lower instrument panel cover with seven (7) screws ( Figure 18).
Install the upper driver side defrost trim panel with one screw on top and one on the side ( Figure 18).

Connect the defrost cable to the defrost air duct up under the instrument panel. Connect the temperature control cable to the Blend Air door in the heater-a/c unit. The defrost setting on the control panel is self adjusting.

If it is necessary to adjust the temperature control knob, turn the knob (center knob on the heater-a/c control panel) ( Figure 19) to full cool mode. The end of the blue color should line up with the index line on the panel ( Figure 19). If it doesn't line up, turn the turnbuckle on the temperature control cable until the end of the blue color lines up with the index line on the panel.

para.emph: To re-install temperature control or defrost cables only, perform the following:

step1.para: Feed control cable(s) behind the instrument panel to the door it controls.
Snap the opposite end of the cable in the cable actuator ( Figure 19).
Install the other end of the cable on the door it controls. The defrost setting on the control panel is self adjusting.
Secure the control panel to the instrument panel with two (2) screws.

If it is necessary to adjust the temperature control knob, turn the knob (center knob on the heater-a/c control panel) ( Figure 19) to full cool mode. The end of the blue color should line up with the index line on the panel ( Figure 19). If it doesn't line up, turn the turnbuckle on the temperature control cable until the end of the blue color lines up with the index line on the panel.
Install the left lower instrument panel cover with seven (7) screws ( Figure 18).
Install the upper driver side defrost trim panel with one screw on top and one on the side ( Figure 18).

svcproc.title: LOW PRESSURE AND HIGH PRESSURE CUT-OFF SWITCH

step1.para: The low pressure switch in the heater-a/c unit and the high pressure cut-off switch on the expansion valve can be removed and installed without removing the refrigerant from the system.
